info.brief_description: version of the game "the hollow" but for fetishes and gay
info.description:
this version is a modification of the hollow so that men can realize their fantasy and dream in a game.

in the game, he has 2 team that compete to gain freedom
each team is made up of 3 players.

before starting the game, the players must individually create a group quests, this quest can contain several stages but also trap stages to slow down, this quests is to realize their fantasy, the player can also choose the character of the quest (the quest is really customizable) but beware the 2 teams do the quest so 6 player = 6 quests that each team must succeed (so that you understand each player create this quest but the 2 teams do it). then each player will have to create an individual quests for each opposing player. which means 1 player create 3 custom quests (personalized to the opposing player) so in the end he will have 6 team quests that must do together and 3 quests that do alone. but to continue the advance all the team must succeed in these quests alone otherwise it is lost for the team.
if a player dies it's lost for his team
the team never meet
if one team loses the other continues the game because they are winners if they finish the game otherwise they will have 2 losing teams.
the end is created by the computer taking into account all the quests.

the winners will be released from the games
the losers will be locked up for eternity in the game and will have to undergo all the quests that are created by the other players of the other party.
the players do not watch and his adult

once all create the player will have to choose his power category (several powers in line with the category)

the trap stage can be all that is possible even sex.

the teams will have to succeed in all the quests (except for the traps quest) otherwise they will have to restart the game from the beginning.

once they have all finished, it enters the game but all their memory will be erased except their name, that they are in a game, that the quests are to be created by them (without remembering what was to be created) and the stakes of the game.
